section.name: The <hst:menu> tag
section.p: <hst:menu> tag shows a dynamic menu as read from content in the repository.

Following table shows the attributes of the tag. An attribute's value is first found by the directly available value, subsequently by a configuration key if present, then by a default value. A configuration key is a key in the configuration file normally called hst.properties, as given by a web.xml context parameter (see here).

tr.td: Optional name by which the tag gets it's context object from request or page context.
The optional location, relative to the context, pointing to the starting location where to search for menu items at level 0.
The optional level indicating the starting level from which default output is generated.
The optional depth indicating, in combination with the level attribute, the end menu level for which default output is generated.
The optional id of this menu that reoccurs as id of the outer div tag of the default output. Also used as request attribute name for custom output.

section.p: Besides the tag attributes, other items can be configured in the configuration file:
section.source:
menutag.document.exclude.names Comma separated list of names of documents that are excluded from the menu. Not required, defaults to all documents named 'index'.
menutag.viewfile(.<id>)= Location of a custom jsp file that is used for outputting the menu, thereby overriding the default output. The view file may be specified per instance with a postfix that is equal to the tag attribute 'id'. Not required, no default.
section.p: To indicate on the repository side which folders and documents (nodes) are part of the menu and which are not, a so-called mixin type can be set on a node. The menu's behaviour is as follows:

ul.li: On the base level of the repository location indicated by the attribute 'location', nodes (typically folders) are included in the menu only if the mixin type hst:menuItem is set.
On deeper levels, all nodes are included.
Folder subnodes are included except when the mixin type hst:childless is set on the repository node.

section.p: The menu item labels are created taking the capitalized name of the node. If this is not applicable, it may further be specified on a node by the String property hst:label.
The default menu output is based on a possibly nested, <ul> / <li> structure. The id of the outermost <ul> tag, useful for CSS styling, is the actual attribute 'id' or the default hst-menu.
The default output will create links for each item, based on reversed URL mapping functionality, see here.

When the configuration item menutag.viewfile is specified, it overrides the default output. Instead, a developer can create it's own HTML with a jsp fragment file, using standard Java or jsp expression language on an object representing the menu.
An org.hippoecm.hst.components.Menu object is present in the request under key 'hst-menu', which may be overridden by the menu tag attribute 'id'.
The tag attributes 'level' and 'depth' are present in the request under fixed keys prefixed by the id: <id>-level and <id>-depth.
The MenuItem objects that are retrieved by the 'items' property have the properties 'label', 'level', 'active', 'path' and 'items'.
Note that path can easily be converted to an URL by the <hst:encodeURL> tag.
